Reported by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 102-483.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 287.
Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Message on House action received in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 102-294.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands

official_title: A bill to rename and expand the boundaries of the Mound City Group National Monument in Ohio.

summary.text: Renames the Mound City Group National Monument in Ohio as the Hopewell Culture National Historical Park. Expands its boundaries to include certain lands. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to: (1) study areas adjacent to those added to the park to ensure the boundaries of those areas encompass lands needed for adequate protection of the significant archeological resources, as well as three named sites (and, at the Secretary's discretion conduct archeological studies of other areas significant to the Hopewell culture); and (2) report to the Congress on its recommendation for addition of any such areas to the park. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: A bill to rename and expand the boundaries of the Mound City Group National Monument in Ohio.
